intro: Hippotis mollis, commonly known as the slender bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is typically found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and marshes. It has specialized structures called bladders that trap small aquatic organisms, aiding in its nutrient acquisition. Hippotis mollis plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to the food web and maintaining water quality.
